description.narrative: a. Receive and make calls to the application through existing three-digit toll free short code. b. Manages region-based calls and direct to appropriate call centers in the six Somaliland regions. c. Customize existing application to handle multiple calls at the same time. d. Provide an option for callers to access up to date information on the virus based on the Ministry of Health and WHO guidelines through toll free number (Telesom will cover Short code and calling minutes). e. Provide Symptoms screening checker to all callers to answer few questions over the phone to determine whether they at risk and provide appropriate advice. f. Speak to caller center operator for further information and support. 2. Assisting capacitate the existing call center in Hargeisa and establish additional 5 call centers with three health workers manning each call center. 3. Train the call center staff to manage the help line platform, receive calls, process audio messages and call back people who could not get through. Provide regular reports to committee and potential high risks cases for action when the times comes. 4. Maintain and support the platform for the duration of the pandemic. 5. The ministry would also create group of their health works system to send out rapid messages. The key feature of the service isthe ability to handle multiple calls, leave voice messages if the caller can#t get through, symptoms screening and provision of up to date information as per the Ministry of Health and WHO guidelines. A total of 18 call center staff volunteers from the Ministry of Health will be trained through a two days workshop in Hargeisa to train them on the platform and dealing with callers during this difficult time. Three call center volunteers will be selected from each of the six main regions in Somaliland including Marodijeex, Awdal, Saxil, Todgheer, Sool and Sanaag. Volunteers will through shifts and lines will be closed from 5pm each day and opens at 7am.During this time, system will direct all callers to voice mail system. It is expected that there will be large number of spam messages and the platform will be designed to handle spam callers.

participating-org.narrative: Shaqodoon is a local nonprofit organization that designs, delivers and evaluates innovative programs to address some of the local most urgent challenges in livelihood skill training, education and health. Shaqodoon has offices and/or presences in Somaliland, Puntland, Galmudug and South Central Somali. Shaqodoon is a national platform whose goal is to prioritize youth employment and educationon the development agenda and to exchange knowledge on effective policies and programs to improve employment andeducation opportunities for youth, prioritizing at-risk youth, marginalized groups, and people who have lost hope and are thus often jailed for local crimes. Shaqodoon Organization is a service provider dedicated to skill development, employment services, youth entrepreneurship, private sector business development, and technology for development. Shaqodoon makes use of participatory methods to ensure youth participate in delivering its services.
